item.title: A resolution recognizing the great progress made by the people of Ukraine in the establishment of democratic institutions, and supporting a free and transparent presidential election on January 17, 2010.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations. (text of measure as introduced: CR S13790)

item.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (text: CR S1129)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(text: CR S1129)
Senate Committee on Foreign Relations discharged by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S1128-1129)
Senate Committee on Foreign Relations discharged by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S1128-1129)
Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations. (text of measure as introduced: CR S800)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S800)

item.name: Sovereignty, recognition, national governance and status

summary.text:
Recognizes the progress made by the people of Ukraine in establishing democratic institutions and carrying out elections on January 17, 2010, and on February 7, 2010.

Encourages all parties to respect Ukraine's independence and territorial sovereignty as well as its integration into the international democratic community.

Pledges support for the development of a free democratic system and a free market economy in Ukraine.

Reaffirms the Senate's commitment to engage the government of Ukraine in further development of bilateral cooperation through the United States-Ukraine Strategic Partnership Commission.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Pledges support for the development of a free democratic system and a free market economy in Ukraine.

Reaffirms the Senate's commitment to engage the government of Ukraine in further development of bilateral cooperation through the United States-Ukraine Strategic Partnership Commission.

bill.title: A resolution recognizing the important progress made by the people of Ukraine in the establishment of democratic institutions following the presidential run-off election on February 7, 2010.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
